item.description:
Pack your cooler and meet us at

 

the BLUEGRASS AND BREWS

 

Sunday, October 23, 2011

Noon - 5:00 p.m.

 No Admission or Parking Fees 

 

Welcome to Nashoba Valley Winery for one of everyone's favorite festivals of the fall season. This festival highlights the hand crafted micro-brewed beers of our brewer Thomas Knight.   Relax, sit back, and enjoy some bluegrass music by Southern Rail.  Stroll by the pavilion, visit JAAS snack shack to purchase a cider donut or a caramel apple, savor the smells of our barbecue provided by the chef’s from our restaurant, J’s.  And finally, we invite you to take a tour of our winery or simply taste many of our award winning wines Sign up for our winery tour in front of the wine shoppe at the information table.

 SOUTHERN RAIL

Southern Rail’s music is high energy exuberant fun, with riveting harmonies, irreverent humor and sparkling banjo and mandolin solo work.  Their songs have graced Bluegrass Unlimited’s Top Thirty Singles Chart receiving heavy national airplay.  Southern Rail has a loyal fan base that makes every concert an event that the whole family can enjoy.  So relax, put down your blanket and enjoy the music.

Nashoba Valley Spirits, Ltd.
100 Wattaquadock Hill Road
Bolton, MA 01740

Wine Shoppe Phone Number - 978-779-5521

 

We accept cash throughout the farm, and cash and credit cards in the Wine Shoppe and J's restaurant.  Please note that we accept CASH ONLY at the pick your own booth and JAAS snack shack. Please keep this in mind when planning your trip to our farm. Using cash for pick your own will reduce your wait time greatly.  And on festivals days, you will need cash to purchase food (see Menu below) or tickets for beer at our Bluegrass and Brews Festival.  For your shopping convenience we do have an ATM in the lobby of the Wine Shoppe.

 

Directions

Nashoba Valley Winery is located at 100 Wattaquadoc Hill Road in Bolton, Massachusetts, less than one hour from Boston, Worcester and other Eastern & Central Massachusetts points.

Look for our  "Attraction" signs on Routes 495 and 290
item.name: check out Bluegrass and Blues
